HDG.LOG.content: omologein as when fateful comes to pass, proper hearing [when does fateful not come to pass? Nietzsche, Derrida], the laying that gathering has sent (die lesende Lege geschickt hat): where, and as what, does the fateful presence?
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: omologein as when fateful comes to pass, proper hearing [when does fateful not come to pass? Nietzsche, Derrida], the laying that gathering has sent (die lesende Lege geschickt hat): where, and as what, does the fateful presence?

HDG.IM.content: word ontology coined in 17th century, question no longer originary > “ontology”: effort to put Being into words, to pass through question of how it stands w/ Being
HDG.IM.linkedContent: word ontology coined in 17th century, question no longer originary > “ontology”: effort to put Being into words, to pass through question of how it stands w/ Being

HDG.BC.content: realm of beings not identical to domain of actual (also: stringency of necessary, wealth of the possible) > strikes ordinary understanding as a truism: a being either possible, actual or necessary > what passes itself off as even more self-evident: “beings” are [“is” method]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: realm of beings not identical to domain of actual (also: stringency of necessary, wealth of the possible) > strikes ordinary understanding as a truism: a being either possible, actual or necessary > what passes itself off as even more self-evident: “beings” are [“is” method]

HDG.BC.content: convulsion of entire world pessimism > for genuine passion of sobriety [Kierkegaard’s GEST]: best optimism too lame, every pessimism too blind
HDG.BC.linkedContent: convulsion of entire world pessimism > for genuine passion of sobriety [Kierkegaard’s GEST]: best optimism too lame, every pessimism too blind

HDG.BC.content: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless

HDG.BC.content: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]

HDG.IWM.content: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]

HDG.QB.content: transcendence ambiguous for essential reasons w/in metaphysics > meanings of transcendence: 1) relation proceeding from beings & passing over to being 2) relation leading from changeable beings to an entity that is at rest 3) supreme entity itself > meta-physical in metaphysics = transcendence
HDG.QB.linkedContent: transcendence ambiguous for essential reasons w/in metaphysics > meanings of transcendence: 1) relation proceeding from beings & passing over to being 2) relation leading from changeable beings to an entity that is at rest 3) supreme entity itself > meta-physical in metaphysics = transcendence

HDG.QB.content: all Saying [of Being, of overcoming nihilism] proceeds awkwardly: must pass through essential ambiguity (Mehrdeutigkeit) of word, turn of phrase > ambiguity of Saying resides (beruht) in a play, the richer it unfolds, remains all the more rigorously maintained in concealed rule (in einer verborgenen Regel gehalten bleibt) [secret] > supreme law of Saying: freedom that frees us for ever playful jointure (allspielende Gefüge) [why jointure?] of never resting transformation (nie ruhenden Verwandlung)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: all Saying [of Being, of overcoming nihilism] proceeds awkwardly: must pass through essential ambiguity (Mehrdeutigkeit) of word, turn of phrase > ambiguity of Saying resides (beruht) in a play, the richer it unfolds, remains all the more rigorously maintained in concealed rule (in einer verborgenen Regel gehalten bleibt) [secret] > supreme law of Saying: freedom that frees us for ever playful jointure (allspielende Gefüge) [why jointure?] of never resting transformation (nie ruhenden Verwandlung)

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, Aristotle’s Physics, must pass through this book to enter philosophy, can replace entire library of philosophical works
HDG.FS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Aristotle’s Physics, must pass through this book to enter philosophy, can replace entire library of philosophical works

HDG.FS.content: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)

HDG.DL.content: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)

HDG.DL.content: [bypassing nihilism of the passing of Es ist] passing of past as gathering of what endures (Währenden), endures as what grants endurance (Gewährende)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [bypassing nihilism of the passing of Es ist] passing of past as gathering of what endures (Währenden), endures as what grants endurance (Gewährende)

HDG.LP.content: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets

HDG.WL.content: Aristotle: vocal sounds a show of the passions in a soul
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Aristotle: vocal sounds a show of the passions in a soul

HDG.WL.content: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth
HDG.WL.linkedContent: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth

HDG.EC.content: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]

HDG.EC.content: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)

HDG.EC.content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary
HDG.EC.linkedContent: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

HDG.OHF.content: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [why phenomenology requires destruction] in any discipline, we’re face to face w/ how things stand at the moment [i.e. how the public world views them] > their showing-themselves (Sich-zeigen) can be so restricted/fixed (festgelegt) by tradition, the inauthenticity goes unnoticed, taken for authentic: one passes off a contingency (Zufälligkeit) as an in-itself, takes a covering up (Verdeckung) for Sache itself > need to get beyond position started from (Anfangsstellung) & arrive at grasp of subject matter free of covering up (zur verdeckungsfreien Sacherfassung zu kommen) > the tradition must be dismantled (abgebaut)

HDG.OHF.content: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such
